title: Adobe | Software Quality Engineer 2 | Noida
content:
**Education**: Btech CS Tier 3
**YOE**: 3.5 years
**Prior Experience**: Top product company based in Pune
**current TC**: 27LPA
**Date of the Offer**: Dec 2024
**Company**: Adobe

Title/Level: Software Quality Engineer 2
Location: Noida
Salary: 22 Lakh (including PF)
Signing Bonus: 2 lakh
Stock bonus: $68,800 vested for 4 years
Bonus: 2lakh performance bonus
Relocation: ticket fare + 14 days stay + 2 month of basic pay + brokerage
**Total comp (Salary + Bonus + 1 yr stocks):** 22 + 2 + 2 + 14.46 = 40.46 Lakh. (excluding relocation package)
Benefits: Standard Adobe Benefits

**Other details:**
For me priority is having good Work-life balance and job security. I will have to relocate to Nodia. 
Is it a low ball, should i negotiate with HR?
Any folks from Adobe, can you please comment about WLB?
Need Suggestions from the community.

title: Yubi SSE | Motive SDE | Software Engineer
content:
Education: Tier 3
Years of Experience: 3.5
Prior Experience: Small startup
Current TC: 17 LPA

Offer 1:
Date of the Offer: Dec, 24
Company: Yubi (a subsidiary of it named Spocto)
Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Bangalore, WFO 5 days
Salary: 24 LPA (will negotiate a bit but not much scope so probably 25)
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 1L
Stock bonus: 0
Bonus: 0
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 24 LPA
Benefits: Usual benefits like Health/Life insurance, 
Other details: Saw reviews, looks like WLB is bad but tech is Spring boot & domain is fintech so future scope looks promising

Offer 2:
Date of the Offer: Dec, 24
Company: Motive
Title/Level: Software Engineer
Location: Remote
Salary: 20 LPA
Relocation/Signing Bonus: 0
Stock bonus: 4000 RSUs vested over 4 years (25% each year) ~ 4-5 L/year approx
Bonus: NA
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 20 LPA + RSUs = 25 LPA in year 1
Benefits: ₹1000 monthly gym reimbursement + ₹2500 monthly wifi reimbursement + ₹30,000 one time allowance for home setup + covered health/dental/vision insurance
Other details: HR not ready to negotiate at all. Tech is ROR so lesser future opportunities. WLB seems good.

Need suggestions on which offer would be better. Will lower base of second offer be an issue during the next switch? TC comes out to be the same overall, and due to being remote overall comp in offer 2 will exceed offer 1 due to RSUs.
